title: Master of Public Health: Master of Public Health: Feinberg School of Medicine
raw_text:
Premiere, multidisciplinary education.
Ask an Admissions Officer - Open Office Hours
Prospective students: See our FAQ page to get answers.
The Master of Public Health (MPH) at Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine in Chicago trains students for a variety of professional roles in public health, clinical care and health research.
LEARN ABOUT US
ACCESS STUDENT RESOURCES
Degree Options
We offer a number of degree options in which students may capitalize on close interaction with faculty leaders to advance their career goals:
MPH
PhD/MPH
MD/MPH
Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT)/MPH
Accelerated Program in Public Health (APHP - MPH 4+1)
Non-Degree Special Students (NDSS)
Ready to learn more about the MPH?
Join our mailing list to receive helpful information about the program.
*
indicates required
Email Address
*
First Name
Last Name
Meet Our Team
Faculty
See their profiles
Community Partners
Visit their websites
Alumni
Stay connected
I gained a broad skillset in everything from epidemiology to healthcare management. Ultimately, this lead me to consider the broader implications of my academic work during my PhD. Getting my MPH also encouraged me to seek employment outside of academics where I felt I could have a different type of impact.
— Nelly Papalambros, MPH, Associate/Consultant at McKinsey & Co., Inc.
Communication principles for community work and a fuller understanding of the public health system have both helped me be more successful in my work implementing programs for the child welfare population.
— Charlie Kraus, MPH, Program Administrator at Northwestern and Illinois Department of Children & Family Services
While in training, I loved being able to take what I learned about disease pathophysiology in medical school and directly apply it to local community education planning and global healthcare delivery in my MPH courses.
— Lisa Akintilo, MD/MPH, current dermatology resident
The knowledge, perspectives and skills gained during my time at Northwestern have truly enriched my medical school experience, and I genuinely feel like I have an advantage over my peers based on my previous educational endeavors.
— Jessyca Turner, MPH, second-year medical student
News
Global Health Day Celebrates Research and International Collaboration
Study Explores Diet’s Significant Role in Global Obesity
Study Uncovers Key Biological Markers in Severe Malaria
Global Health Education Day Celebrates Mentorship and Collaboration
More News

CEPH Accredited
Our program is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH), an independent agency dedicated to assuring excellence in public health education. Visit the CEPH site to learn more about the accreditation process.
Learn more about the CEPH
Our CEPH Accreditation
